result.name: irish-sea-annual-egg-production-method-aepm-plankton-survey-2000
result.notes:
Between August 6th and September 6th 2000 a series of ichthyoplankton surveys 
were carried out in the Irish Sea by the Centre for Environment, Fisheries and 
Aquaculture Science, the Department of Agriculture and Rural Development 
Northern Ireland and the Department of the Marine to improve stock assessment 
by the egg production method. Target species were cod (Gadus morhua) and 
plaice (Pleuronectes platessa). The data described here consists of the 
numbers of fish eggs and larvae and zooplankton, along with associated 
positional and ancillary data and volumes filtered.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Irish Sea Annual Egg Production Method (AEPM) Plankton Survey - 2000

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
resources.name: Cefas Data Portal
